title: Running Testscript : ValueError: Video path does not point to a file
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I am using the GPU version of DLC with the correct CUDA packages. I have then gone to run ipython testscript.py and I get a value error as seen in below. 

### Operating System

Windows 10

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version 2.2.1 

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Conda activate DEEPLABCUT
2. (DeeplabCut) cd Desktop\DEEPLABCUT\examples
3. ipython testscript.py
4. See Error

### Relevant log output

```shell
(DEEPLABCUT) C:\Users\fs17974\OneDrive - University of Bristol\Desktop\DEEPLABCUT\examples>ipython testscript.py
C:\Users\fs17974\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\statsmodels\compat\pandas.py:65: FutureWarning: pandas.Int64Index is deprecated and will be removed from pandas in a future version. Use pandas.Index with the appropriate dtype instead.
  from pandas import Int64Index as NumericIndex
C:\Users\fs17974\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\__init__.py:78: UserWarning:
        As PyTorch is not installed, unsupervised identity learning will not be available.
        Please run `pip install torch`, or ignore this warning.

  warnings.warn(
Imported DLC!
On Windows/OSX tensorpack is not tested by default.
CREATING PROJECT
Project "C:\Users\fs17974\OneDrive - University of Bristol\Desktop\DEEPLABCUT\examples\TEST-Alex-2022-05-19" already exists!
EXTRACTING FRAMES
Config file read successfully.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
File ~\OneDrive - University of Bristol\Desktop\DEEPLABCUT\examples\testscript.py:80, in <module>
     77 deeplabcut.auxiliaryfunctions.write_config(path_config_file, cfg)
     79 print("EXTRACTING FRAMES")
---> 80 deeplabcut.extract_frames(path_config_file, mode="automatic", userfeedback=False)
     82 print("CREATING-SOME LABELS FOR THE FRAMES")
     83 frames = os.listdir(os.path.join(cfg["project_path"], "labeled-data", videoname))

File ~\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\frame_extraction.py:246, in extract_frames(config, mode, algo, crop, userfeedback, cluster_step, cluster_resizewidth, cluster_color, opencv, slider_width, config3d, extracted_cam, videos_list)
    236 if (
    237     askuser == "y"
    238     or askuser == "yes"
   (...)
    242     or askuser == "ouais"
    243 ):  # multilanguage support :)
    245     if opencv:
--> 246         cap = VideoReader(video)
    247         nframes = len(cap)
    248     else:
    249         # Moviepy:

File ~\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\auxfun_videos.py:31, in VideoReader.__init__(self, video_path)
     29 def __init__(self, video_path):
     30     if not os.path.isfile(video_path):
---> 31         raise ValueError(f'Video path "{video_path}" does not point to a file.')
     32     self.video_path = video_path
     33     self.video = cv2.VideoCapture(video_path)

ValueError: Video path "C:\Users\fs17974\OneDrive - University of Bristol\Desktop\DEEPLABCUT\DeepLabCut\examples\TEST-Alex-2022-05-19\videos\reachingvideo1.avi" does not point to a file.
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
